Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2007 03:20PM pnut2 wrote: hello, i walked in your shoes in march. i also had the fogginess. i was diagnosed with the same. i had a 5.5 centimeter tumor with one hiding behind. i received aggressive treatment of abraxane. tumor has shrunk and the one hiding is gone. maybe a mastectomy will come later. please please please, get a copy of all of your reports and tests. make sure you are comfortable with you ps and surgeon and oncologists. if you are having doubts about the results, i beg you to get a second opinion. do you want to have a mastectomy first or do you want to have chemo first? so many decisions. make sure you have someone that can ask and answer questions. i was lucky to have a several friensd who were nurses to accompany me. you Will make. i have you at the top of my prayer list. please update us on your progress. love you and my friends send you lots of hugs and well wishes.
Posts.Title: Results are in - invasive ductal nanc512 knapppa

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2007 07:31PM pnut2 wrote:  i also have dark skin. mine has become very dry through my treatments. what i have found that has helped my skin are a couple things.1) Burts Bees vitamin e oil. 2) a coconut body butter that is sold in health food stores only. it is 100 percent organic coconut. i wish i could remember the name. what you need to do is go to a reputable health food store. alot of them tend to have herbalist that work there that can give you good recomendations for your mom. good luck.
Posts.Title: after care organic products proudaughter Poppy_Spruce

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2007 10:34AM pnut2 wrote: hey ladies. i am doing another round of chemo. this time its 4 treatments of ac. when i was doing my neoadjuvant i was on abraxane only. what a breeze that was. i then had my bilateral, and was put back on chemo again. next friday is my last treatment, can't wait. this has been really taking a toll on my psyche. i didnt realize how sick the ac was going to make me. the sight of anything red throughs me into fits. if i have to eat jello and popsicles any time longer i will pull my hair out!!! (oh wait, i don't have any hair) that fell out again when i started my ac. my chemo nurse (bless her heart) has to cover up the ac with tape so i dont have to look at the color. i was told by my surgeon today, that my healing from my mastectomy will take a while due to me being on  ac. kudos rocktobermom for suggesting on bringing the ipod. last week when i went for treatment, there was a real annoying woman sitting next to me telling her dear father who was getting a treatment of all the people who died of cancer because chemo didn't help. i had to blast the ipod so i wouldnt hear her running of at the jawls.i think the look i gave her after awhile shut her up. please god don't let me see her next week. anyway, i have told all my friends and family what "I" would like for thanksgiving. the reason;  on march 21 i lost my appetite due to treatments and medicines and surgeries. i am going to enjoy all my favorite foods then hit the treatment trail again with radiation. after all of this, i am the happiest person in the world. i have been blessed with a new outlook on life. i am more confident and outspoken. i dont take "crap" from anyone anymore. but for the first time i love myself %100. amazes me that it took cancer to find out how special i was, and how loved and adored i was by others.
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: pnut2 wrote: hey ladies how are you??? four weeks ago i had a bilateral mastectomy. it was a very difficult recovery time for me. several days after surgery, i had a massive hematoma. i had to return to the hospital for emergency surgery. all is well now. i had my last jp removed this past tuesday. i was given the ok to return to work. tomorrow will be my first day back. on wednesday september 19th i return to my oncologist to see what my next treatment will be. my radiologist said that he spoke to my onc, and my onc is thinking maybe another round of chemo instead of radiation. i will let you ladies know what the final decison will be. by the way; 19 nodes were taken out of my left arm, and only 3 had signs of cancer!! praises be to God. i do still have pain, numbness and swelling, but i am so happy to have successfully crossed this bridge. love you all. talk to later!!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: i am back!! pnut2 sue_blue

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2007 04:22PM pnut2 wrote: my insurance pays 80% of my bras and prosthesis. i am allowed four bras and 2 prosthesis per year. the camisole i will pay out of my pocket.the prosthetic store files the paperwork for me. will go monday to be measured. insurance company says i have to get prosthetics and bras after my surgery not before.
Posts.Title: Prostheses/Insurance? GrandpaBambu pnut2

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2007 04:15PM pnut2 wrote: hi honey. i cried when i read this. please see if there is a support group near the town you live to help you. also, continue to writ here. i have foud out that the people u depend on sometimes are not there. also, i have learned certain people have their own ways of masking there fear. this could be your parents way. please sit down with them privatly and discuss this. dont have your husband be there. this is your time. also, realize this is not the time you should have toxic people in your world.

Posts.Title: Found lump this morning.. gad janet11 Member_of_the_Club

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2007 05:47PM pnut2 wrote: just finished my 12th treatment with my abraxane. i only had mild side effects of the medicine. my tumor was extremly large with another hiden behind it.the tumor that was hiding disappeared. the other shrunk considerably. several of my nail beds turned slightly blue. of course i had hair loss. i was able to work 4 days a week in a hectic job in a hospital. my doctor absolutely loves abraxane. i now know why. i did get extremly ill at one point. i had awful migraines and nausea. it turned out to be the zofram i was prescribed. i was taken off of it and prescribed phenagran. mind you, i have a long way to go, but it was made easy with the abraxane. i also was given aloxi as a part of my treatment.
Posts.Title: abraxane ? kbugmom RoseLady

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2007 11:02AM pnut2 wrote: hey ladies! have good news myself. had my ct scan last week, and my mri (breast) today. saw my oncolgist this afternoon. even though we dont have the results of mri, i have the results of ct scan. my tumor has shrunken to .9 X 1.7 cm. it was 5.5 x 5.4 when i started chemo 12 weeks ago. my left lymph node was 2.7 x 1.6 cm. it is now .6 x 1.4 cm. my next visit is tomy surgeon and ps for a date and time to get my mastectomy and my new breast. feel so happy and relieved. yeah!!!!
